revised_title: Optimizing Agricultural Yield and Crop Selection for Sustainable Food Production
tldr: The article discusses the importance of considering food processing technologies and user needs when choosing crops for agricultural production. It examines the impact of technological advancements in milling and baking on the proportion of homegrown wheat in British bread and the potential for increasing self-sufficiency in feed and food wheat varieties. The article also explores the prospects of alternative protein sources, such as oilseed rape, field beans, and lupins, for British farms.
